intro: Hieracium paurophyllum, commonly known as the paleleaf hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring temperate climates. Its leaves are usually pale green and have a distinctive, rough texture. Hieracium paurophyllum produces yellow flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators.
